Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at great location”
Reviews.Author: Rutger v
Reviews.Content: A nice and small hotel at a great central location. Great room, good beds, air-conditioned even though a very old building. Totally refurnished. Job well done. Location is really wonderful, nice street and in the heart of the city. An experience I won't forget!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room and friendly excellent service”
Reviews.Author: GertDL
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here and will absolutely return when we return to Paris. Excellent location near subway and major attractions within walking distance. Comfortable and stylish boutique hotel with a 'personal' touch and friendly staff. Very peaceful and quiet, we loved relaxing with a drink from the bar in front of the fire in the cosy lounge.

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Hotel in a Romantic City”
Reviews.Author: Majesh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel du Jeu de Paume last June for 6 nights. This is a small, cozy hotel located on the Isle of St. Louis in heart of Paris! Rooms are comfortable and good size for Paris and well decorated. The hotel has a beautiful atrium and a contemporary feeling! However, there is no view from the rooms! But, its centrally located and you can walk by the Cathedral of Notre Dame every day and we practically walked the whole city of Paris from this place. There are some cute restaurants and fancy shops on the same street and you can sit outside and enjoy a glass of wine with gorgeous views of Seine River and Notre Dame! So relaxing and peaceful yet in the middle of a frantic city!

Reviews.Title: “Paris Lover”
Reviews.Author: Deidre D
Reviews.Content: A friend and I recently stayed at the Hotel du Jeu de Paume in Paris. I'm a frequent visitor to Paris and this is now my favorite hotel in Paris. The hotel is beautiful and the location is amazing. It is convenient to most major Paris sights and there are delicious restaurants and bakeries within walking distance. I highly recommend the Hotel du Jeu de Paume.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a romantic travel”
Reviews.Author: tenmorro
Reviews.Content: This is a small, beatifully decorated and charming boutique, well-located in a quiet place in the very heart of Paris. Nothing to compare with the standards hotels like novotel, lafayette...where the feeling of silent and relaxation are very complicated. Only two negative comments: - if you turn off the air- heating there is a disturbing sound that I think comes from the tubes and the quality of breakfast that is medium.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Henley on Thames, null, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Comfortable central hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anthony L
Reviews.Content: A most relaxing place to stay in Paris - and very quiet for such a central location. It is in a beautiful area with interesting shops and restaurants nearby, as well as being handy for many of the city's sights. The room was well-furnished and comfortable, although a little on the small side. The bathroom was attractively furnished - including a bathtub - and toiletries were of high quality. The staff were friendly and helpful. The continental breakfast was of good quality, although it was a bit limited for the €14 price.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuluLaurel
Reviews.Content: Terrific location (easy walk to either bank) and very nice front desk staff (made dinner and art exhibit reservations for us, called taxis, printed boarding passes). Nicely done renovation of an old, beamed building. We stayed in two rooms at the start and end of our trip - not big, but each with a comfortable bed, small desk, chair flat screen tv, free wifi, nice bathrooms (tubs, rain fall shower heads; toilet in separate small room). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A quaint quiet retreat in the middle of Paris”
Reviews.Author: JohnS1952
Reviews.Content: Many have written that Hotel du Jeu de Paume is a fantastic, hidden gem on I'lle Saint Louis in Paris. They are absolutely correct. The hotel is entered from the main street of the island via an inner courtyard. The rooms are on average slightly larger than many European hotel rooms. The staff are terrifically helpful and completely bilingual. The combination of the historic with modern design is most charming. If you are fortunate to stay on the second floor (we were in Room 202), you will wake to exposed beams overhead. You may wake late because there is no street noise on this quiet island in the center of Paris. The only thing that might upset you is the price of breakfast (~18 Euros per person for juice, coffee and croissants). However, a block away are several local brasseries where the same breakfast can be had for about 7 Euros. Rue Saint Louis is lined with shops and restaurants of every type. While the crowds on many Paris streets can be overwhelming and tiring at times, it is nice to return to I'lle Saint Louis where tranquility reigns (except on Sunday). Yes on Sunday, the crowds are huge as many locals descend on the island to shop (stores in most other areas are closed) and eat Berthillion ice cream, a local favourite. The island and hotel are literally about 200 meters from I'lle de Cite the home of Notre Dame Cathedral and the hidden wonders of the stained glass in Saint Chapelle. The left bank (tourists abound) is only a block or two further. You can easily walk to the Louvre in about 20 minutes at a relaxed pace. This is the perfect hotel and location for couples wishing to experience a romantic visit. Oh yes, don't go to Paris in the summer - visit in early October when the weather is fine and the maddening hordes of tourists have gone back to suburbia.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: BunyipJr
Reviews.Content: An absolutely amazing location! Quiet, private, outstanding service and beautifully appointed. Everything about this hotel was fantastic and made our stay in Paris magical.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average stay, rooms on the dirty side”
Reviews.Author: vacationtime2000
Reviews.Content: We came here for a romantic get-away. It is an amazing location right in the center of Paris in I'le St. Louis. Notre Dame is a stone's throw away and many other "tourist" destinations are super close. The metro is about 20 minutes walking distance by Hotel de Ville. The room was rather small (but it's Paris). And, housekeeping was really poor. We stayed for a week and the room was only clean the day we arrived. I noticed hair on the floor that was never swept away, dust in the bathroom and bedroom that was never cleaned throughout out stay. And, if you're not a smoker try not to get a room by the garden. It seeped into our room so often that we had to keep our windows closed for most of our stay. On the plus side one of the front staff gentleman was super-friendly. Otherwise, service was just okay. Not overly welcoming or congenial. I most likely would not come back. There are other hotels in the price range that are worthy trying.

Reviews.Title: “Love the location and the style”
Reviews.Author: Emjayess331
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel du Jeu de Paume 9 years ago on the recommendation of a cousin and loved it so much that we went back in September of 2011 for 3 nights. The location can't be beat...on the intimate-feeling Ils St Louis, just a couple hundred meters over a bridge to either the right bank (Marais, Pompidou Center, Louvre & Orangerie, great shopping & restaurants) or the left bank (Sorbonne, faded existentialist hangouts, more shopping and restaurants, Eiffel Tower and more museums). A couple of terrific little restaurants within a block or two, the tempting Berthillon ice cream shops (more of them than Starbucks in Manhattan) galleries and other small shops, you soon have a feel that it's your own neighborhood. The hotel staff are very welcoming and competent. The lobby and rooms have an elegant, very modern Euriopean design sense. The room was very comfortable, not too snug, and quite well appointed. Avoid the pricey breakfast in the lobby and go to any one of the 3 or 4 corner bars for your morning cafe & croissant or baguette with butter & jam. Remember to pet the golden retriever who seems always to be stretched out in the lobby -- 9 years ago and last week, too. We plan to return on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “historic ambience, old world charm, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: cleoSeattle
Reviews.Content: the Hotel Jeu de Paume has beauty, excellent service, quiet , fabulous location and great Internet values. I would recommend it to anyone who is looking for this type of elegance and care for the traveler enjoying Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: Kritisk
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a friend in April. Small room, but clean. Location is very nice, friendly service too. A bit to much noice for my liking, so would not stay here again. And our beds was awfull!

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Naysy
Reviews.Content: I read before staying here that the rooms were tiny. Well I've stayed in much smaller in the US! I found it perfectly sized. The Annick Goutal toiletries were a nice touch, the bath perfect after a day walking around. I plan on staying here every time I come back to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely building, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JohnWilly
Reviews.Content: The conversion from the old real tennis court is impressive and lovely. Room comfortable, quiet (2nd floor) and well equipped. Staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast good (but pricey). Location is very good for sightseeing, walking and local restaurants, although other tourists are hard to avoid here.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely but overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: chalkhill-blue
Reviews.Content: A charming boutique hotel within a few minutes' walk of Notre Dame and the Pompidou Centre. The location could not be better. Despite being close to the left bank and with many great restaurants nearby, the hotel itself is tucked away behind an unimposing entrance and is quiet and secluded. The decor is attractive and the rooms are chic and comfortable. The staff are helpful and speak good English. BUT..... there is a major drawback â€” the price. Considering its limited facilities, the Hotel De Jeu de Paume has no business to be charging nearly â‚¬300 Euros for a standard (and rather small) double room. There is no proper restaurant, the tiny bar was never staffed while we were there, and there is not even an internet connection unless you have a laptop or wifi device. The rooms have no drink-making facilities and at â‚¬18 per person for coffee and croissants, breakfast was exorbitantly expensive! I would like to be able to recommend this hotel as we had a very pleasant stay. But even for Paris it represents poor value. For what it offers, a more realistic price would be â‚¬160 to â‚¬180 a night and for this you can certainly find somewhere comparable in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Very expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: suefinley
Reviews.Content: My husband, two children and I stayed here for three nights, mainly because other reviews had said how spacious the rooms were. We were traveling with our 10 and 12-year old, and have been to Paris several times and understand how small most hotel rooms are. We decided to splurge and rented a suite, which said it came with air conditioning and free wifi. The suite turned out to be two very small rooms stacked on top of each other connected by a curved staircase, with only air conditioning and wifi on the top floor. Neither the a/c nor the wifi reached the downstairs, requiring the upstairs occupants to turn the a/c on as high as possible and hope that some drifted downstairs. The only window in the bottom room was actually a glass door which opened onto a public hallway and courtyard, making opening that door to let in some air completely impossible. The windows on the first floor of the suites section were covered only with a thin, gauzy material, so that when one returned to the room at night, the other occupants were completely visible in their rooms if they had the lights on, even though they expected that they had privacy with the "curtains" shut. Enough said on that... This made the downstairs part of our suite dark, hot and claustrophobic, and very unpleasant for the two people sleeping downstairs. At 560 Euros a night ($785), it was honestly a terrible value. We were traveling with a group, and were frankly sick when we saw what the other members in our party had booked at a third the price. Other negatives were the price of breakfast: 18 Euros ($25) per person per day, which on top of the $785 we were already paying seemed outrageous, and the fact that they do not allow outside food to be brought in "for health reasons," even though they serve room service in the rooms. (Read: we prefer you buy our food from us.) Positives: friendly and helpful front desk staff, nice dog in the lobby, a brilliant location in the city, accessible to everything, nice upstairs bathroom, good water pressure, comfortable beds. I can only imagine, after reading the other reviews, that the other rooms in the hotel are much nicer than the suites, which are located in a separate building.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful oasis in middle of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Betomata
Reviews.Content: Delightful hotel in middle of Paris, highly recommended. Comfortable rooms, bedding and great AC. Could have better breakfast (buffet versus served) and better towels but its location and comfort make you forget those little things.

Reviews.Title: “Charming historical boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: homeplanner
Reviews.Content: My 24 year old daughter wanted to avoid the touristy areas and chose the Hotel du Jeu de Paume for three reasons: 1) The location 2) The price 3) for the suites Check out the location--it is wonderful. This tiny, historical hotel is nestled in an absolutely delightful block of typical Parisian shops. They have the butcher, the baker, the chocolate shop, the cheese shop, a couple of foie gras shop, ice cream shops, restaurants and various interesting retail stores. Walking distance to several great areas. And the best of all, we were able to have separate bedrooms and two baths for about what we would have paid to have two separate rooms with no guarantees we would be near each other.

Reviews.Title: “Small jewel, well-appointed with attentive personnel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: CarolAnnO
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ancient building and like most Paris hotels has very small rooms. But there is a wonderful attention todetail: Annick Gutal bath products, free Wifi, good storage considering its size, bath robes. All the amenities you expec in a larger hotel. They even have a towel warmer, In the lobby lounge, there's a small bar, adaily papers and a couple of bookshelves filled with loads of travel books, about half of them on Paris. Everyone who worked there spoke English and was responsive to all our needs. The main street of the Ile can get really busy on weekends aand at nioght but the rooms are not on the street so you only have to fight the crowds to get there. Once in the hotel, it's a haven.

Reviews.Title: “Charming small family run hotel on a delightful island at the heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: Colvin
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at this hotel for many years, but this was our first visit for a while, and it was wonderful to be back. It has become a home from home. You cannot beat the romance of the Ile St Louis, a small island barely 100m wide and 300m long right in the centre of Paris, barely 200m from the rear of Noter Dame: it is Paris's best kept secret. The narrow main street is lined with delightful shops selling clothes, artisan food, arts and crafts, antiques - and the island's best product, without a doubt, Berthillon ice cream: taste it and forget every other ice cream you have ever tasted. There are a handful of small restaurants and, at the end of the island nearest Notre Dame, a couple of bars, where you can sit and watch the world go by. This is a village right in the middle of Paris and its main street, which throngs with people by day, becomes quite at other times. Get off the main street and the rest of the island is blissfully quiet, so you can sit on the riverbank and read your book in peace. The hotel is concealed by huge wooden doors, which open into a passageway and external atrium: once you are in the hotel you leave the bustle behind and enter the blissful tranquility of the hotel, which was beautifully and sensitively converted from an old real tennis court by the present owner's father. The previous reveiwer describes it perfectly: if only those ancient massive beams could talk, what a tale they would tell! The bedrooms are smallish but certainly not cramped, and have been recently upgraded and modernised: they are light and airy, the beds are extremely comfortable, and the rooms contain everything you could need. Choose a room on the first or second floor if you are inn the main part of the hotel: they will be quieter. The owner and staff are extremely accommodating: they will recommend and book restaurants for you, to suit your taste, and there is a big 'Paris guide book' section in the hotel's library just inside the salon to help you plan your stay. Nothing is too much trouble and when the rather restricted dining area inside the hotel was full when we came down for breakfast on the Saturday morning, they served our meal outside in the very pleasant, sheltered garden / yard area - very pleasant. We wouldn't think of staying anywhere else in Paris: if the hotel was booked we wouldn't come.

Reviews.Title: “a uniquely designed, excellent small hotel, perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: SeafarerRI
Reviews.Content: Jeu de Paume is a small, very well designed and superbly located hotel in Paris. It is one of only a few hotels, all small scale, located on Ile St Louis, the small island in the Seine River next to Ile de la Cite, home to Notre Dame cathedral. It seems that an architect restored the centuries-old building, exposed all the original wooden beams, kept a great deal of the space of the building open, inserted an unobtrusive glass-walled elevator, a ground floor bar, a very comfortable outdoor sitting ( and smoking ) area on a patio near the massive street entrance doors, a breakfast area on the ground floor, and a sitting/reading area as a balcony inside the atrium of the building on the second floor. There are several rooms on the ground floor, with garden areas. The second and third floors each have a number of rooms, some of them - including the one we stayed in for three nights- overlooking the inner courtyard garden. A giant magnolia tree was outside our window. The room preserves the ancient wooden beams, but is in all other ways contemporary in design; with very comfortable bed, very good lighting, adequate closet space, and a very functional bathroom, with bath and shower, plus separate room with toilet. Robes, slippers and toiletries are supplied. With it's off-street location, the rooms are very quiet at night. Breakfast includes fresh orange juice, fresh bread and pastries. It is much more than adequate. Service staff are friendly, helpful, able to communicate in very adequate English, and eager to help arrange taxis, recommend local restaurants and advise about attractions in the area and cultural events in Paris. We followed their suggestions several times, and were glad we did. Ile St Louis is mainly a residential neighborhood; but one located in the heart of Paris. There are a large number of historically significant buildings that ring Ile St Louis, almost all of them having stone facades and wonderful views over the Seine. There are no large streets on the island, and it remains a community where people live for years and decades. The owner-architect of the Jeu de Paume Hotel deserves great praise for having restored a building worth saving, and for converting it into a wonderful small hotel. It is the kind of place you want to return to again and again. I hope we get the chance to do just that.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Paris, stayed twice and it's where we'll stay next time.”
Reviews.Author: bearfisher
Reviews.Content: Tremendous location, less than 10 minutes from latin quarter or the Marais. Hotel is clean, attractive and lived up to expectations on every level. Staff couldn't have been friendlier or more helpful. Lots of the rooms have exposed ancient wooden beams, but hte rooms are bang up to date. Stayed in lots of places in Paris but this was our second stay and we wouldn't contemplate staying anywhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: annainparis
Reviews.Content: We spent our honeymoon in Paris and stayed at the hotel for three nights. It's a bit expensive but the location is excellent. A lot of nice restaurants in the area. Just a short walk from Marais, Bastille, Hotel de Ville and St Germain. We recommend this place because of the extremly nice staff, the excellent location and because the hotel's very clean, charming and has a special history.

Reviews.Title: “amazing location great staff”
Reviews.Author: brockcork
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay here. Smack bang in the centre of the city on one of the most historic parts of it. Notre dame and the marais, left bank are all just a hop away. Room very clean and checked twice per day. Our room had air con and was on the first floor. The hotel itself has a very interesting history and the front desk called for a cab for us one night, had no problem with accomodating us when our airline delayed us and were very happy to let us print of our boarding passes on their computer. Will definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelQueenEugeneOR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Jeu de Paume in September, 2009. I have stayed on Ile St. Louis once before but at another hotel and did not have the same experience as we had here. The location is absolutely perfect. One metro station is a short distance away and another, with an RER line, is not too far away. We found the service in this hotel to be excellent. The front desk staff were friendly and very helpful. The room was not as small as expected and advertised on the website, which was nice. It was nicely decorated and the beds were comfortable. But, again the location is what is worth the cost of this hotel. There are numerous shops and restaurants very close by, you walk by one of the most beautiful symbols of Paris, Notre Dame, every day and there is lots of interesting entertainment on the bridge from Ile de Cite to Ile St. Louis. We are returning to Paris in September 2011 and we will definitely book here.

Reviews.Title: “Picture perfect hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Simbo4168
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend in Paris. The Hotel was perfect for what we wanted, which was a central easy to reach location. The Hotel is an oasis of calm and tranquility in the city centre chaos of Paris. The lack of air conditioning in the room was made up for by being able to have the windows open over the peaceful courtyard. The location overall was second to none. Prices for food and drink were a bit toppy and so we did not eat or drink in the Hotel as there are cheaper alternatives on every street corner. All in all an excellent hotel that I would have no hesitation recommending.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made us cancel the rest of our trip”
Reviews.Author: bluey85
Reviews.Content: This hotel was marketed as a very romantic spot with excellent photos of the hotel on the website. When we got here, the main reception area of the hotel was indeed lovely, and that's all that was lovely. The room was cramped with barely enough space to walk around the bed, the bedcover was filthy and yellowed and torn, there were stains on the walls, the airfilter above the toilet was completely black with dirt, and the showerhead was clogged up also. Nothing "romantic" about the room whatsoever! Hotel manager didn't care and shrugged at us when complaining. We ended up leaving early as we could not face staying in that room any longer. More shrugging, huge fuss over giving us a receipt for the bill - we'd paid in advance and no chance of getting back a penny from them. Would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone - stay well away!

Reviews.Title: “Location surpasses service”
Reviews.Author: lovefoodhtx
Reviews.Content: The location is the reason for this hotel's success, it could not be better. The service is acceptable, some of the staff are friendly, other could not care less. I was there over a week and wanted a radio but they could not comply saying they do not offer radios (I should have simply bought one). The room for single travelers has a very nice bath and tub, the hotel is uncommonly quiet, but the space is very confining. I would recommend this hotel only to friends who want the convenience of their location (near ND, culture venus, Monde Arabe).

Reviews.Title: “This hotel ruined our vacation”
Reviews.Author: holidayNyc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Paris for our anniversary. We chose this hotel based on a number of reviews which described the hotel as romantic. While the location and the communal areas were nice the room was very shabby and unclean. The toilet didn't flush (we asked for this to be fixed but that never happened which was pretty unpleasant for the wkd!). The main issue however was the staff. They were awful. Unfriendly and unhelpful are not qualities you look for from people working in a hotel. We were very pleased to be leaving. When we checked out we asked them to order us a taxi. They said this wasn't something they do. So we had to trudge around with our bags in the rain for 20 mins trying to hail a cab.

Reviews.Title: “lovely little hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikerphd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved the location and the charm. It is NOT a full- featured chain hotel (so if you want that, stay away), but we found the staff friendly, the room comfortable, and not overpriced (by "European capital" standards).

Reviews.Title: “Tired but charming”
Reviews.Author: talkative
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights in May 2008 & this must be the 5th or 6th time we've stayed in the Jeu de Paume over the last 10 years. The pros are that it is in a great spot (the ile st louis is charming). The staff are friendly & helpful. The rooms are a reasonable size for paris & the biggest rooms of any hotel on the ile. The house keeping is good. The public areas are beautiful, spacious, comfortable & air conditioned. The cons are that the rooms are not airconditioned - this can be an issue in june-august. & to be frank the decor in the rooms is now a little dated & tired. If you can forgive that you'll have a very good stay.

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: tripletswilltravel
Reviews.Content: My sister and i stayed here for several days during april when she was running for the marathon. i thought it was a little expensive, but was willing to pay more to be close to everything and be comfortable. the room was small but clean. you could pay to use the internet in the basement, but it was very expensive. the staff was very helpful with directions and where to eat. it is not like an american hotel, but i have stayed all over europe and it beats many european hotels. ]] the location can not be beat. close to notre dam and subway stations. has an elevator (another unusual feature in european hotels)

Reviews.Title: “Charmed by Jeau Du Paume Hotel sle St Louis”
Reviews.Author: pippy_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in August for 3 nights - we had a double room and our daughters had a twin room right next door. Whilst the rooms were not large, nor airconditioned (as advised prior to our stay by the hotel management) they were very nice, with opening windows and shutters out onto a small enclosed courtyard - this meant we had lots of fresh air and no noise at night. We could also talk to our daughters via the windows! Whilst my husband and I didnt notice the heat nor were we hot, our daughters were and rang room service for a fan in the middle of the night, and they were brought a fan very quickly with no problems at all by a happy staff member. The bathrooms, were small, get used to it, you are in europe, but definitely all worked and were bright and clean. The added bonus (in my view) was that the toilet was in a separate room in our room. Lovely sitting room areas downstairs which were nice to relax in. We felt the management were very friendly and welcoming and were more than happy to assist us whenever we sought it and make bookings for us at restaurants nearby. the hotel is in the most fabulous location right in the middle of Paris and I would definitely go back and stay here again, just even for the location. Yes, it probably is expensive, but the location is hard to beat! We didnt eat breakfast in the hotel which was fairly basic, coffee, fruit, croissants sort of thing, but instead chose to wander around till we found a cafe we liked where we could watch the world go by, while we breakfasted. I would definitely recommend this motel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “This is a gem”
Reviews.Author: oceanographer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Jeu de Paume on and off since the early 1990's and it always pleases. The rooms are not big - the facailities not extensive - but it is a very friendly and comfortable hotel in - what in my opinion - is the nicest part of Paris. The Ile St.Louis is village Paris at it's best - devoid of heavy traffic, nice shops and central location. The hotel is in a very old building and is brimming with character. Service is always good - room service consists of delicacies from the local delicatessen (there is not restaurant in the hotel - but many very good ones in 5 mins range for all tastes and budgets). It isn't cheap - but is it good value? I think so. I always come away with a smile on my face. Central Paris hotels are not cheap, I have stayed in beter value, and posher, but this sits neatly between the two.

Reviews.Title: “Good Decision”
Reviews.Author: Ski_Luv
Reviews.Content: Planning a first time trip to Paris isn't easy, we had a hard time deciding where to stay. But after reading every travel book on the subject, one thing was repeated. Isle St. Louis is the best location. They were right. But once that is decided, which hotel? There actually aren't many options, but we LOVED the Jeu de Paume. We were lucky enough to be able to afford a duplex. I don't remember the number of our two level room, but it was the one at the end of the hall that runs behind the front desk along the garden area. I would never stay anywhere else if I return. And the gentleman at the front desk gladly helped me with my French when needed. Oh that's it!!! Room 14, I remember asking him how to say it, Catorze, or however you spell it. It was kept very clean, and had good square footage compared to most Parisian hotels. On the down side: they go out of their way to tell you not to bring your own food in. Our bags were pack to the gills with drinks, wine, snacks, and breakfast food which we just kept hidden and cleaned up. Every morning we stopped at the street garbage bin with our bagged refuse. Also, just a pot of coffee for the room isn't on the menu. We asked for it along with the price, and checked the bill at the end. One morning we were charged the full breakfast price, which was immediated corrected when we noticed it. PS the gelato across the street is to die for. And the little desk upstairs in room 14 makes a great vanity.

Reviews.Title: “Unromantic, complete rip-off”
Reviews.Author: bobbyintexas
Reviews.Content: i reserved a 2-floor suite for 4 nights in april, 2007, to celebrate my girlfriend's birthday. the cost was approximately 545 euros nightly. please believe me when i tell you that the room was not worth 100 euros - it was not clean, it was not functional, and it was not cared for by the proprietor/owner natalie. the location is terrific but everything else is disgusting. i argued at the front desk and secured a full refund and returned to the lovely pavillon de la reine in the marais for a lovely room for 430 euros. AVOID THIS HOTEL AT ALL COST - IT IS DISGUSTING AND IT IS NOT RUN BY PEOPLE WHO UNDERSTAND HOSPITALITY. bobby in texas

Reviews.Title: “I feel at home at the Jeu de Paume!”
Reviews.Author: parisencore
Reviews.Content: Location, interior architecture, service, ambiance. I feel at home when I arrive at the Jeu de Paume. I've stayed there 3 times. Admittedly, I have a background in architecture, and design is important to me. The JDP is an amazing renovation of an historic building! The street entrance has one of those traditional blue-painted doorways and the main entrance is off the courtyard off the street, making it very private. The downstairs has a small front desk and is primarily a series of comforatable, distinctive sitting areas (where you can have a drink) and a breakfast area punctuated by a glass elevator which allows the user to view and appreciate the half-timber space. It feels like a series of mini living rooms that are shared by all the guests. There is an upstairs sitting area, too. So you don't have to stay in your typically small Paris hotel room all the time. Rooms are small and the reservation confirmations from the hotel all state this fact to level expectations. I've stayed in 3 different rooms and all had nicely redone baths with marble accents and robes. Bathtubs were standard American sized and deep. One bath had the toilet in a separate room. All rooms had fabric-covered walls with a little piece of artwork--nothing fancy. Rooms come with a small TV and minifridge that I use for snacks I get at the open air markets. Walls are thin yet no thinner than at other Paris hotels. Occasionally this is a problem if the neighbors are noisy, but it all depends on your neighbors. I always bring earplugs for travel anyway. I love the ability to watch CNN International and regular BBC, neither of which I get at home. A friend stayed in a room here and said the floor sloped. I never had that problem or at least I never noticed it. On my first stay there I could not get consecutive nights for the length of my stay, which I extended after arrival due to loving it so much, and the staff graciously called all the hotels in the area to get me a room for the one night the JDP could not accommodate me. Gotta love that! The staff has always been willing to make dinner reservations for me and recommend restaurants that locals go to. Through the staff I found an amazing seafood place that impressed my European friends multiple times. I usually have to depart early before breakfast service starts and the front desk person will make me a coffe to get me going. Upon returning to the hotel after a day of Paris I am always greeted with a "bonjour mmle parisencore". Those foil packages of shampoo that another reviewer mentioned are Annick Goutal Eau d'Hadrien shampoo and bubble bath. Yum! You don't get this quality of product except at top tier places like the Crillon. Visit the AG store; it's not cheap but the scents are wonderfully French. Part of what you pay for is location on the Ile St Louis. This is a quiet street that has a number of interesting shops and boutiques. You step out your door and it feels like Paris should feel. It's easy walking distance to the Marais and a healthy walk to the Latin Quarter. I've had decent meals at the restaurants down the street. I'm a big shopper and one of the best aspects of this location is the Pont Marie Metro Station. It's 2 minutes from the hotel and a short direct ride to the department stores (mo: Chaussee d'Antin) without having to change at the dreaded Chatelet! If you are carrying a lot of shopping bags you will appreciate this. It's also a direct route to the Louvre/Tuileries/Palais Royale (and A Priori The). The only real issue I have with the JDP is that the breakfast is overpriced, minimal, and has Viennoiserie rather than a lovely flakey French croissant. This is a shame as the breakfast area in the hotel is quite lovely and comfortable, and would be given justice with a fresh OJ, and egg or yogurt, a croissant, along with their nice strong coffee. I usually get fresh OJ at the market around the cornet and keep it in my minifridge. Now that the USD is so weak, all French hotels are expensive. I first stayed here when the dollar was stronger and the JDP was a bargain. Relative to what you get for the price, I do love the JDP and I can't imagine a stay in Paris without it.

Reviews.Title: “I always stay on the ille st. louis”
Reviews.Author: Emmarubybegonia
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. I can overlook a lot for location, and this is my favorite location in all of Paris. I may be in a rut, but this little island in the middle of the Siene calls to me. I just love it here. There are only 3 hotels (as far as I know) and they are all on the same street. I've stayed at 2 out of the 3. This was my first stay at this hotel. It's a little more upscale than the last one I stayed in. I had a very small single room, but it was spotlessly clean, really comfortable bed, bathroom fine, quiet and very pleasantly furnished/decorated. Nothing elaborate. A little pricey, but hey, it's the historic heart of Paris. It is literally strolling distance to Notre Dame, St. Chapelle, the L. Bank, the R. Bank - in the middle of everything. Tiny streets lined with great little shops, ice cream, bakery, bars, restaurants. You feel like a local when you stay here. Hotel has a great staff - very friendly and go out of their way to be helpful. Nice bar/lounge. Nice outdoor patio spaces. I actually was able to park my rental car in front of the hotel overnight (only stayed one night - was on way to Loire Valley) - a miracle since the street is so tiny. Parking is a nightmare in this area, and I was prepared to park the car in a public lot across the river after I dropped off my luggage - But Voila! There was this nice little spot right in front. Super! I would most definitely stay here again as long as the weather is good (not too hot). It is not air conditioned, and if you have to leave your windows open, you have zero privacy. It's quiet, but it is surrounded by other buildings very close. Zero privacy if your windows are open. Winter - no problem. I'm sure it is warm and cozy. I was afraid there were going to be mosquitoes because of close proximity to the river - nope - never saw one bug of any kind. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “There are much better choices than this one!”
Reviews.Author: altalag
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week in the 2 bedroom apartment. The location was wonderful. The staff was helpful and warm. However, the room was extremely over priced for a space that was shabby, dirty, and lacking in character. The room was very dusty, the dishes were dirty and the window blinds filthy(as in grossly filthy). The worst part was the noise. The room is located directly across the street from a tourist attraction - the french version of Medieval Times - lots of drunk patrons. Some nights our apt was so loud we could not get to sleep until 2am. Another negative is that this hotel requires half payment as a non refundable fee due the week before arrival, I suspect because they know people would leave otherwise. Very few hotels in Paris require this and I would never "fall" for this policy again. They also do not have wi-fi. They charged 20 Euros for an hour of the slowest internet service on the planet. I have never paid that much for the internet at a Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons...their price was outrageous! I chatted with some of the other guests at the hotel and sense that the regular rooms were far better. I never saw one so I can't judge. I do know that I would never stay in the "apartments" again.

Reviews.Title: “Every year since 1989”
Reviews.Author: MichiganFrancophile
Reviews.Content: This ideally located hotel was opened in 1988....my first of many stays there was in 1989 and each year when I traveled to Paris, I always tried to get a room at L'Hotel du Jeu de Paume, becoming over time a "habitue".....we became friendly with the owner and her daughter, Madame Elyane Prache and Nathalie Hecker and with their, now deceased dog, Enzo. Once when we visited at Lent, a wonderful Gateau du Roi awaited us...so large, we had to share it with the entire staff of 15......The last time we were there , a slight problem with the sewage beneath the hotel caused some odor problems...in fact, one guest left in the middle of the night, creating for the staff a terrible embarrassment......but, like good friends everywhere, small inconviences are offset by the gentility of the people and we would not hesitate to return ...........

Reviews.Title: “Stay on the I'lle of St. Louis”
Reviews.Author: kangaroo95
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel, Wonderful Location We loved this hotel the staff was so friendly and helpful. The locations couldn't be better with many boutiques, great restaurants it is hard to the leave the island. If you do leave a couple blocks away is the marais district a very trendy fashionable area that we loved shopping in. This island is very charming with street musicians. I have stay in Paris several times but from now on I am going to stay on the island. The reviews from this website lead me here where correct. The other hotels on the island also looked nice and are probably more reasonable. We never had breakfast since it was 18E and there were several bakeries and cafes one or two doors down. If you are wondering where to stay in Paris the i'lle of St. Louis is the place to stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel du Jeu de Paume
HotelInfo.Address: 54, rue Saint-Louis-en-l'Ile, 75004 Paris, France
